passage_text: As long as they were cooked (and I would have to beleive they were if you bought them at a store), one can keep crab on ice or better yet in the freezer for 6 months or more even if they're not cleaned. Fresh (live) crab can not be stored in the fridge. They must be kept alive in aerated water until cleaning and cooking. Putting them the fridge (or freezer) before cleaning them will cause them to die and dead crab is BAD crab.
